title: Meta takes aim at Twitter with the launch of rival app Threads
description: The new app aims to attract disenfranchised users of Twitter, which has experienced numerous issues and controversial changes since Elon Musk took over as CEO of the company.

title: Toxic microalgae alert on the Basque coast
description: "Ostreopsis", which is already present on the Mediterraneann coast, has been spotted in the south of the Bay of Biscay as early as spring. Its proliferation can cause migraines, fever, respiratory difficulties and intestinal problems.

title: The European Commission wants to deregulate the 'new GMOs'
description: The proposed legislation to treat crops derived from new genomic techniques as conventional varieties has aroused strong opposition on the left and in civil society.

title: Black activist Angela Davis struck off name of French school
description: The conservative head of the Paris region, Valérie Pécresse, said the university professor and former Black Panther has views that 'feed communitarian feeling and can encourage violence.'

title: Cocaine found at White House, Secret Service investigates
description: The powder's discovery in the West Wing on Sunday was initially considered a potential danger, prompting a brief evacuation.

title: The anguished exile of Hong Kongers in Taiwan
description: The island has been the most immediate refuge for many pro-democracy protesters who risked being sent to jail at home after the events of 2019. Nowadays, however, many of them struggle to obtain visas and feel unsafe.

title: Russian-speaking community's loyalty called into question in Lithuania
description: In Visaginas, 10 kilometers from the Belarusian border, where Russian-speaking residents make up three-quarters of the population, Moscow's invasion of Ukraine has heightened tensions.

title: PSG president urges Mbappé to sign new contract
description: Kylian Mbappé said last month he would not extend his contract, which expires next year, but has indicated he wants to keep playing with PSG for a final season.

title: Sigourney Weaver: 'When I started out, it was all about the young white male audience'
description: The 73-year-old actress, equally at home in action films and smaller productions, plays a wealthy heiress having an affair with her gardener in Paul Schrader's new film, 'Master Gardener'.

title: Greta Thunberg charged over Swedish climate protest
description: The climate activist had joined a protest against fuel use in Malmö's harbor last month.

title: Alain Delon's children file complaint against assistant
description: The French actor has been in a weakened condition since a cardio-vascular incident in 2019, prompting the hiring of a woman to assist him at his home.

title: Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya: 'Belarus is at the heart of Putin's regional strategy'
description: The Belarusian opposition leader is calling for tougher sanctions against Alexander Lukashenko's regime, following the exile of Wagner leader Yevgeny Prigozhin to the country.

title: Tuesday was Earth's hottest day on record
description: Global temperature records were broken for the second day in a row, after average temperature hit 17.18º C. Experts expect the record to be broken again very soon.

title: Tour de France: Hindley takes stage win and yellow as Pogacar suffers
description: Tadej Pogacar is now 53 seconds behind defending champion Jonas Vingegaard in the overall standings.

title: The crumbling utopian dream of Nanterre's towers, where France's riots began
description: Built in the 1970s, the Pablo-Picasso social housing estate, the epicenter of the riots following the death of Nahel M., was the embodiment of an ambitious urban planning vision. But this social project failed to live up to its promises.

title: Just Stop Oil protestors disrupt Wimbledon match
description: Two climate protestors ran out in the middle of a match on Wednesday and threw plastic orange confetti and jigsaw pieces on the court before they were removed.

title: Teenagers and the climate crisis: 'It's worrying for the future, but not for my life'
description: Young people find it hard to associate the consequences of climate change with their own lives and their attitude largely depends on that of their parents, despite a generational divide.

title: Deteriorating health of former Georgian president triggers diplomatic row with Ukraine
description: The imprisoned opposition leader Mikheil Saakashvili appeared so thin at his trial that Volodymyr Zelensky expelled the Georgian ambassador in protest. Tbilisi denounced this as an 'escalation.'

title: PSG appoint Luis Enrique as manager
description: Paris Saint-Germain is to hold a press conference Wednesday, where they are expected to present their new manager.

title: French senator sparks outcry with 'ethnic' riot comments
description: Bruno Retailleau, who heads the conservative party Les Républicans in the Sénat, said immigrants who took part in riots following the death of a teenager killed by police last week had undergone 'an ethnic regression.'

title: Ukraine's top anti-corruption official: 'We have become more efficient'
description: Oleksandr Klymenko, the head of the Ukrainian anti-corruption prosecutor's office, who has been on the job for a year, explains how Kyiv strives to improve its fight against bribery.

title: Israel ends West Bank raid as Palestinians grapple with destruction
description: The Israeli army claimed to have inflicted heavy damage on militant groups in the Jenin refugee camp in an operation that included a series of airstrikes and hundreds of ground troops.

title: Top French court says Channel town must give migrants water
description: According to the decision, local authorities in Ouistreham would be subjecting migrants to 'inhuman and degrading treatment' unless they build taps, toilets and showers 'in the immediate vicinity' of their camp.

title: EU justice commissioner says French police and protest violence are 'a problem'
description: Didier Reynders said the high level of violence at demonstrations concerning the cost of living, pension reform and last week's police killing of a teen driver is 'striking.'

title: Two hours in Jenin with the Israeli army
description: After two days of operations, the military believes it has weakened the last major insurgent stronghold on the West Bank, at the risk of fueling Palestinian anger.

title: Macron suggests blocking social media during riots
description: The French president has raised the idea of limiting or even cutting off access to social media platforms during episodes of urban violence – a practice until now reserved for authoritarian regimes.

title: Riots ease in France with fewer arrests made
description: Police counted 16 arrests overnight, eight days after the killing of a teenager by police sparked the worst urban violence in years.

title: Riots in France: PM Borne accuses Mélenchon of being outside 'the republican field'
description: The prime minister denounced left-wing party La France Insoumise's refusal to unambiguously call for appeasement, while other left-wing politicians also condemned their ally.

title: Riots in France: Death of man in Marseille referred to police inspectorate
description: An investigation has been opened after the death of man on Saturday who was hit in the chest by what was 'probably' a 'Flash-Ball-type projectile,' according to prosecutors, citing a weapon commonly used by police.

title: 'Macron is going to have to find the right words to reassure and to counter the far right'
description: The French president's two terms of office have been marked by recurrent major tensions, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz. While not holding the country back, they're dangerously deepening existing fractures.

title: French imams are overwhelmed in wake of riots
description: As their neighborhoods went up in flames, some Muslim leaders tried to intervene. Others preferred to stay on the sidelines, to avoid getting involved in politics but also because their influence is limited.

title: Hong Kong: Repression of democracy activists is spreading abroad
description: John Lee, the chief executive of Hong Kong, wants exiled dissidents to 'live in fear.' He has set up a retribution system to enable the arrests of eight activists, including Nathan Law, Ted Hui and Dennis Kwok.

title: Riots in France: Businesses in crisis yet again after damage and looting
description: With the retail sector still recovering from the Covid-19 pandemic, potential losses of 'more than a billion euros' could not have come at a worse time, for local shopkeepers and multi-national chains alike.

title: War in Ukraine: The Kherson church defying Russia
description: In this town close to the front line, the parishioners of the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary Orthodox Church have chosen to leave the Moscow Patriarchate to join that of Kyiv, after a long history of Russian domination and manipulation.

title: Denise Bombardier, queen of outbursts and controversy, has died
description: The Canadian journalist made her mark in the '90s when she confronted writer Gabriel Matzneff whose writing glorified relationships between minors and adults on the set of the French TV show 'Apostrophes.'

title: Expansion of 'ultra low emissions zone to all of Greater London is hotly contested
description: Judges at the High Court of Justice of England and Wales are set to rule as of Wednesday on the extension of the zone restricted to the cleanest vehicles from August 29.

title: Israel begins withdrawal from Jenin as rockets fired from Gaza
description: Witnesses said on Tuesday, July 4 they saw convoys of Israeli military vehicles leaving Jenin in what appeared to signal an end to an Israeli operation. Five rockets were fired at Israel from the Gaza Strip but were intercepted.
